required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trail of Polyethylene Glycol vs Sodium Phosphate for Colonic Cleansing of Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trail of Polyethylene Glycol vs Sodium Phosphate for Colonic Cleansing of Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to compare polyethylene glycol and sodium phosphate for colonic cleansing of colonoscopy.

primary_outcome.description: The quality of colon cleansing was assessed by the endoscopist with Boston bowel preparation scale.

secondary_outcome.description: time to cecal intubation and withdrawal time

secondary_outcome.measure: the degree of difficulty of the procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the procedure of colonoscopy
secondary_outcome.description: 6-point scale: extremely easy, easy, fairly easy, fairly difficult, difficult, extremely difficult

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the procedure of colonoscopy
secondary_outcome.description: For polyps or other endoscopic lesions, a histopathologic diagnosis was systematically obtained and recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the procedure of colonoscopy

arm_group.description: For all patients of this group, polyethylene glycol solution should be taken orally for colonic cleansing of colonoscopy
For all patients of this group, sodium phosphate solution should be taken orally for colonic cleansing of colonoscopy

intervention.description: All patients should receive dietary guidance, and eat a low-residue diet three days before colonoscopy. For polyethylene glycol group (group P): the day before colonoscopy, 750 mL (1 box) of polyethylene glycol solution should be drunk 2 hours after dinner; the other 1500 ml (2 boxes) of polyethylene glycol solution should be taken 4-6 hours before the examination. After oral laxatives were finished, 20 ml dimethicone would be taken orally as defoamer. All the enteroscopy should by performed by the same juniar clinician, and related indicators were recorded.

All patients should receive dietary guidance, and eat a low-residue diet three days before colonoscopy. For sodium phosphate group (group S), 750 mL (1 box) of sodium phosphate solution should be drunk 2 hours after dinner; and the other 750 mL (1 box) of sodium phosphate solution should be taken 4-6 hours before the examination. After oral laxatives were finished, 20 ml dimethicone would be taken orally as defoamer. All the enteroscopy should by performed by the same clinician, and related indicators were recorded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients meet the following criteria: 1) age 18-60 years; 2) BMI 18.9-28; 3) Heart, lung, liver, and kidney function can tolerate colonoscopy; 4) Patients and their families are able to understand and be willing to participate in this clinical study and to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1) colorectal surgery history (except appendectomy); 2) patients with intestinal obstruction, incomplete obstruction, intestinal hemorrhage; 3) patients with renal insufficiency; 4) patients with hirschsprung disease; 5) patients with inflammatory bowel disease during active period, which affects intestinal observation; 6) patients who are bedridden and lose the moving ability ; 7) have a history of severe mental illness; 8) pregnant or lactating women; 9) patients with other clinical conditions considered by some researchers should not participate in the trial.

facility.name: the First Hospital of Jilin University

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to make individual participant data (IPD) available to other researchers.
